SENT.plain: Traumatic posterior circulation aneurysms are rare, especially in children
They are typically associated with severe trauma and are thought to result from either direct osseous injury or stretching or compression of an artery against the tentorium
They may grow, rupture, or both
Although spontaneous thrombosis may occur, it rarely results in complete occlusion
We report the spontaneous and complete thrombosis of a large posterior cerebral artery aneurysm in a child who presented after minor head trauma
Five-year follow-up documents the complete occlusion of the aneurysm
